about.information-1: Private Prompts is a privacy-first solution created by Frank Börncke, with partial funding from the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (FKZ 01IS24S44).
about.information-2: It enables you to harness AI’s power while keeping your personal or confidential data strictly on your own device, never exposing sensitive details to cloud services.
about.information-3: For downloads, documentation, and further details, visit:
about.frank-boerncke-homepage: Homepage of Frank Börncke - Learn more about what I do
about.contact-frank-boerncke: Email the Author - Feel free to get in touch
about.funding-parties: The Prototype Fund is a project of the Open Knowledge Foundation Germany, funded by the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF).

protectedWorkbench.headline: Private Prompts - you own your data

promptManager.filter-prompts-tooltip: Search/filter your prompts, tags, and descriptions
promptManager.add-prompt-tooltip-prefix: Add a new Prompt to the top of your list. Currently you have
promptManager.filter-prompts-hint: Search within descriptions, prompts, and comments
promptManager.edit-prompt-unsaved-changes: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to discard them?
promptManager.rename-tag-explanation: This will rename the tag in all prompts where it is used. Do you want to proceed?
promptManager.rename-platform-explanation: This will rename the platform in all prompts where it is used. Do you want to proceed?
promptManager.snackbar-missing-information: Prompt must have a description or content to be saved

rulesTab.add-rule-tooltip-prefix: Define new sensitive data pattern which will be added to the end of your list. Currently you have
rulesTab.incomplete-rule-dialog-text: An incomplete rule will not be saved. Do you want to delete the draft or continue editing

help-text-privacy-rules-explained.title: Help - Privacy Rules Explained
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.intro_1: With Private Prompts, you decide what information is private. Create rules to match or replace specific words or patterns in your prompts before sending them.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.intro_2: Use curly braces to replace sensitive info with random data. This keeps the text structure while removing sensitive data. Private Prompts will restore original values after processing.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.intro_3: Pseudonymization replaces real data with random but realistic looking placeholders.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.intro-static: Start with static rules to replace specific words, names, or emails before processing. Define rules to mask private info.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.outro-static: Mask any private info before sending your request.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.intro-smart-matcher: Use smart matchers to detect and replace sensitive data automatically. These placeholders replace data with random values.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.outro-smart-matcher: Private Prompts tries to detect values automatically. Define static rules if needed.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.intro-reg-exp: Advanced users can use regular expressions to define complex patterns for detecting and replacing sensitive data.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.outro-reg-exp: If you are not familiar with regular expressions, then start with simple rules or use smart matchers.
help-text-privacy-rules-explained.supported-smart-replacement-placeholders: Use these expressions on the right hand side of the rule to replace data with placeholders while keeping prompt structure intact.

setupTab.backup-and-restore: Backup & Restore - All settings including prompts and rules
setupTab.manage-your-prompt-sets: Export or merge your Prompt Sets
setupTab.manage-your-private-data-definition-rule: Manage your Private Data Definition Rules
setupTab.private-prompts-configuration-file-path: Private Prompts stores your settings in an unencrypted JSON configuration file. Depending on your usage profile this file may contain sensitive data. In case you want to clean up or backup the file you can find it here:
setupTab.open-ai-api-key-hint: Optional: You may enter an OpenAI API Key and use the protected workbench to send prompts directly to OpenAI.
setupTab.open-ai-api-key-warning: Warning: This prototype of Private Prompts can be used without entering an API Key. When you choose to do so then note that your API key is currently stored unencrypted on your device. The API key is never shared.
setupTab.open-ai-api-key-save-tooltip: Save your OpenAI API Key to directly send prompts to OpenAI from Private Prompts.
setupTab.reset-application-explanation: You can reset the application to its initial state. This action will delete your custom prompts and privacy patterns.

importExport.export-app-configuration-button-tooltip: Export all data to a JSON file. Useful for backups or sharing settings with another device
importExport.import-app-configuration-button-tooltip: Import all data from a JSON file. This overwrites the current configuration
importExport.export-prompt-set-button-tooltip: Export your current prompt set to a JSON file
importExport.import-prompt-set-button-tooltip: Import prompts from a JSON file
importExport.export-rule-set-button-tooltip: Export your current rule set to a JSON file
importExport.import-rule-set-button-tooltip: Import rules from a JSON file
